metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2669 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in contrib/hstore/hstore_io.c in PostgreSQL9.0.x before 9.0.16, 9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.xbefore 9.3.3 allow remote authenticated users to have unspecified impactvia vectors related to the (1) hstore_recv, (2) hstore_from_arrays, and (3)hstore_from_array functions in contrib/hstore/hstore_io.c; and the (4)hstoreArrayToPairs function in contrib/hstore/hstore_op.c, which triggers abuffer overflow.  NOTE: this issue was SPLIT from CVE-2014-0064 because ithas a different set of affected versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.12-1
No subscription required

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
libecpg6 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
libpq5 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1bzr2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.12-1').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.3.3-1bzr2').
